recipes.title: Chipotle Apple Braised Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is District 7 Estate Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: District 7 Estate Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Our 2012 vintage has aromas of tropical fruit and butterscotch that lead into a lively blend of pear, pineapple and citrus flavors

recipes.instructions: Heat the oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium heat; then add the chicken. Brown on both sides for approximately 5 minutes per side. (You may have to do this in two batches.) Cut the apples into quarters and then in thirds (You want them to be in large chunks). Add all of the chicken back to the pot along with the apples, cider and Chipotle Apple Pie Spice. Cover the pot and simmer for 30 minutes over low heat.

steps.step: Heat the oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium heat; then add the chicken. Brown on both sides for approximately 5 minutes per side. (You may have to do this in two batches.)
Cut the apples into quarters and then in thirds (You want them to be in large chunks).
Add all of the chicken back to the pot along with the apples, cider and Chipotle Apple Pie Spice. Cover the pot and simmer for 30 minutes over low heat.
